subject: fork="no" unexpected behavior
msgSnippet: I am trying to run more than one JUnit test from Ant which shares some static data through the VM. The following is an excerpt from my Ant script.
messageBody:
I am trying to run more than one JUnit test from Ant which shares
some static data through the VM. The following is an excerpt from my
Ant script.

<target name="test">
<junit fork="no">
<test name="SupplierTest"/>
</junit>

<junit fork="no">
<test name="ConsumerTest"/>
</junit>
</target>

The problem is, the VM seems to fork whether I tell it too or not. My
first test (SupplierTest) is creating some static objects, and my
second test (ConsumerTest) is trying to use those objects. The
problem is that either Ant is creating a new VM or a new ClassLoader
so my data is not available.

Any ideas?
